Body: Possible Duplicate:  Galaxy Tab is not being charged through USB Cable  I can't charge Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 from my USB. Is this a malfunction or intended behaviour?I know that the mains charger supplies four times the power of a single USB port, but I'd assume the tab can at least be maintained if not charged with the 500 mA of USB.However, when the tab is plugged in, I see a red cross over the battery icon and the phone status screen says "Discharging".How do I fix it?
Title: Can I charge Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 from USB?

history.Text: As the title says, I can't charge the tablet from my USB. Is this a malfunction or intended behaviour?I know that the mains charger supplier four times the power of a single USB port, but I'd assume the tab can at least be maintained if not charged with the 500mA of USB.However, when the tab is plugged in, I see a red cross over the battery icon and the phone status screen says "Discharging".![Screenshot][1]Ideas?
